documentId: Understanding Arguments_ An Introduction to Informal Logic (1)
content:
fetus has a right to life. No
doubt  the  mother  has  a  right  to  decide  what  shall  happen  in  and  to  her
body;  everyone  would  grant  that.  But  surely  a  person’s  right  to  life  is
stronger and more stringent than the mother’s right to decide what happens
in and to her body, and so outweighs it. So the fetus may not be killed; an
abortion may not be performed.
It sounds plausible. But now let me ask you to imagine this. You wake up
in the morning and find yourself back to back
